title: Ihave summons for chase bank how to answer
question: I got summons for chase But I working with attorney for banckrupcy so I have 30 day to respond my lawyer say dont worry no respond they just want your case number and will be ready in aprox 4 week so but I dont fill comfotable so can i do something else
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Credit,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and student loans,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
Please just listen to your attorney. Your bankruptcy filing should take care of the lawsuit, and discharge the underlying debt.

Disclaimer: This post does not constitute legal advice and does not create an attorney-client relationship. Do not act, fail to act or otherwise rely on this post. Consult a licensed attorney in your jurisdiction.

I would be sure that your attorney knows the date you were served and has a copy of the lawsuit, so that he or she can put the collector/creditor's attorney on notice that you are about to file the bankruptcy. Once they know that, some collection attorneys may dismiss their case, because they know that they are not going to get anything from you.

I have a question for you about your debt, which your posting describes as "long time." Does that mean that you have not paid it in a long time (such as, more than four years since your last payment) or do you mean that you've been paying on it for a long time? Also, is this $60,000 in debt mostly credit cards and other personal loans, or is some of it student loans, which are very difficult to get discharged in bankruptcy? If you want, contact me through my Avvo profile.

Listen to your bankruptcy lawyer. Your bankruptcy petition will include this debt to Chase, and once you file the petition, your lawyer will serve Chase's lawyer and file a notice with the court where Chase's lawsuit is filed, and this will "stay" (meaning stop) the Chase lawsuit. When the bankrupcty is done, your debt to Chase will be discharged.
